trans-unit.source: Accessing the Network Server by using the network client driver

seg-source.mrk: Accessing the Network Server by using the network client driver

target.mrk: Accessing the Network Server by using the network client driver

trans-unit.source: When connecting to the Network Server, your application needs to load a driver and connection URL that is specific to the Network Server. In addition, you must specify a user name and password if you are using authentication.

seg-source.mrk: When connecting to the Network Server, your application needs to load a driver and connection URL that is specific to the Network Server.
In addition, you must specify a user name and password if you are using authentication.

target.mrk: When connecting to the Network Server, your application needs to load a driver and connection URL that is specific to the Network Server.
In addition, you must specify a user name and password if you are using authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "Using in-memory databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: For both driver and DataSource access, the database name (including path), user, password, and other attribute values must consist of characters that can be converted to UTF-8. The total byte length of the database name plus attributes when converted to UTF-8 must not exceed 255 bytes; keep in mind that in UTF-8, a character may occupy from 1 to 4 bytes. You may be able to work around this restriction for long paths or paths that include multibyte characters by setting the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> system property when starting the Network Server and accessing the database with a relative path that is shorter and does not include multibyte characters.

seg-source.mrk: For both driver and DataSource access, the database name (including path), user, password, and other attribute values must consist of characters that can be converted to UTF-8.
The total byte length of the database name plus attributes when converted to UTF-8 must not exceed 255 bytes; keep in mind that in UTF-8, a character may occupy from 1 to 4 bytes.

You may be able to work around this restriction for long paths or paths that include multibyte characters by setting the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> system property when starting the Network Server and accessing the database with a relative path that is shorter and does not include multibyte characters.

target.mrk: For both driver and DataSource access, the database name (including path), user, password, and other attribute values must consist of characters that can be converted to UTF-8.
The total byte length of the database name plus attributes when converted to UTF-8 must not exceed 255 bytes; keep in mind that in UTF-8, a character may occupy from 1 to 4 bytes.

You may be able to work around this restriction for long paths or paths that include multibyte characters by setting the <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> system property when starting the Network Server and accessing the database with a relative path that is shorter and does not include multibyte characters.

trans-unit.source: The filename for tracing output. Setting this property turns on tracing. See <xref href="cadminappsclienttracing.dita#cadminappsclienttracing"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve message text from the server. A stored procedure is called to retrieve the message text with each <codeph>SQLException</codeph> and might start a new unit of work. Set this property to <codeph>false</codeph> if you do not want the performance impact or when starting new units of work.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve message text from the server.
A stored procedure is called to retrieve the message text with each <codeph>SQLException</codeph> and might start a new unit of work.
Set this property to <codeph>false</codeph> if you do not want the performance impact or when starting new units of work.

target.mrk: Retrieve message text from the server.
A stored procedure is called to retrieve the message text with each <codeph>SQLException</codeph> and might start a new unit of work.
Set this property to <codeph>false</codeph> if you do not want the performance impact or when starting new units of work.

trans-unit.source: If set to <codeph>create</codeph>, create the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

seg-source.mrk: If set to <codeph>create</codeph>, create the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

target.mrk: If set to <codeph>create</codeph>, create the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

trans-unit.source: This property is also available using <codeph>EmbeddedDataSource</codeph>. See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information. Similar to setting <codeph>connectionAttribute</codeph> to <codeph>create=true</codeph>. Only <codeph>create</codeph> is allowed; other values equate to <codeph>null</codeph>. The result of conflicting settings of <codeph>createDatabase</codeph>, <codeph>shutdownDatabase</codeph>, and <codeph>connectionAttributes</codeph> is undefined.

seg-source.mrk: This property is also available using <codeph>EmbeddedDataSource</codeph>.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information.
Only <codeph>create</codeph> is allowed; other values equate to <codeph>null</codeph>.
The result of conflicting settings of <codeph>createDatabase</codeph>, <codeph>shutdownDatabase</codeph>, and <codeph>connectionAttributes</codeph> is undefined.

target.mrk: This property is also available using <codeph>EmbeddedDataSource</codeph>.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information.
Only <codeph>create</codeph> is allowed; other values equate to <codeph>null</codeph>.
The result of conflicting settings of <codeph>createDatabase</codeph>, <codeph>shutdownDatabase</codeph>, and <codeph>connectionAttributes</codeph> is undefined.

trans-unit.source: If set to <codeph>shutdown</codeph>, shut down the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

seg-source.mrk: If set to <codeph>shutdown</codeph>, shut down the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

target.mrk: If set to <codeph>shutdown</codeph>, shut down the database specified with the <codeph>databaseName</codeph> property.

trans-unit.source: This property is also available using EmbeddedDataSource. See the for more information. Similar to setting connectionAttribute to shutdown=true. Only shutdown is allowed; other values equate to null. The result of conflicting settings of createDatabase, shutdownDatabase, and connectionAttributes is undefined. If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, database shutdown is restricted to the database owner.

seg-source.mrk: This property is also available using <codeph>EmbeddedDataSource</codeph>.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information.
Only <codeph>shutdown</codeph> is allowed; other values equate to <codeph>null</codeph>.
The result of conflicting settings of <codeph>createDatabase</codeph>, <codeph>shutdownDatabase</codeph>, and <codeph>connectionAttributes</codeph> is undefined.
If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, database shutdown is restricted to the database owner.

target.mrk: This property is also available using <codeph>EmbeddedDataSource</codeph>.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information.
Only <codeph>shutdown</codeph> is allowed; other values equate to <codeph>null</codeph>.
The result of conflicting settings of <codeph>createDatabase</codeph>, <codeph>shutdownDatabase</codeph>, and <codeph>connectionAttributes</codeph> is undefined.
If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, database shutdown is restricted to the database owner.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>setAttributesAsPassword</codeph> property, which is available for the embedded DataSource, is not available for the client DataSource.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>setAttributesAsPassword</codeph> property, which is available for the embedded DataSource, is not available for the client DataSource.

target.mrk: The <codeph>setAttributesAsPassword</codeph> property, which is available for the embedded DataSource, is not available for the client DataSource.
